channel.title: Linux for Lawyers on underWater desert Blogging
channel.description: Recent content in Linux for Lawyers on underWater desert Blogging

item.title: Gnome Shell Extensions -- Those Little Bundles of Joy
item.description: There are two great things about Gnome Extensions. First, what you can do with them. Second, the user experience of installing them via a very slick webapp.

item.title: How I Use Multiple Workspaces
item.description: Multiple workspaces took me some getting used to, but now I find them indispensable. Here's how I use them.

item.title: Working with PDFs in Linux
item.description: Working with PDFs in Linux is not perfect. There is no one program to rule them all as Adobe has done with Acrobat in Windows and OSX. But there are good, viable solutions which can do almost everything that Acrobat will do.

item.title: Remembering Your Packages
item.description: What programs (packages) do I use? This is a perennial problem. It is always easy to remember those packages you use all the time but what about those packages that you do not but you want them there when you need them. Here is a three step system for ensuring that you never forget to reinstall packages you want when you upgrade your system or reinstall you operating system.

item.title: Conky -- Smooth Operations
item.description: Conky is a wonderful addition to your Linux desktop. It is a very lightweight system monitoring application which can be designed to look very different to fit your style. Here's my setup.

item.title: Why Using Shells are Great
item.description: Using a shell in a terminal is fantastic – like a glassbottom boat view into what your computer is actually doing. Here are some tips and a small tutorial of how I set up my terminal and shell to get you started.

item.title: Linux 4 Lawyers -- Encrypting your hard drives
item.description: On why Linux is grand – this post discusses why you should encrypt your hard drives.
